issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fixVersions.description: Last release before 0.10.0, will contain the features for 0.10.0, the time between 0.9 and 0.10.0 is going to be used to stabilize the release

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

versions.description: The release will stabilize core components, improve performances and adds new streaming algorithms. Unmaintained code is getting killed as part of this

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Clustering
components.description: Bugs related to any of the clustering packages

fields.description:
From time to time this test fails with following in build log:
{noformat}
Tests run: 3, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 48.134 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.mahout.clustering.streaming.cluster.BallKMeansTest
testClustering(org.apache.mahout.clustering.streaming.cluster.BallKMeansTest)  Time elapsed: 2.051 sec  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<625.0> but was:<796.0>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:494)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:592)
	at org.apache.mahout.clustering.streaming.cluster.BallKMeansTest.testClustering(BallKMeansTest.java:119)
{noformat}


Here is a bit more of build log output, which also shows other tests were running in parallel with this one:

[INFO] parallel='classes', perCoreThreadCount=false, threadCount=1, useUnlimitedThreads=false

Last time test failed it was on ubuntu-1 node, but it's also randomly successful on same node so it doesn't seem to be caused by something node specific.

author.name: tdunning
author.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body:
The problem was that the test data was not seeing that this should be using the test seed and the test is not
deterministic.

updateAuthor.name: tdunning
updateAuthor.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

author.name: tdunning
author.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body: Here is a patch that should solve this.

updateAuthor.name: tdunning
updateAuthor.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Nice. I guess same issue might affect {{StreamingKMeansTest}} and {{StreamingKMeansTestMR}}, both of which make use of {{DataUtils.sampleMultiNormalHypercube}} without setting test seed first. If not modifying {{DataUtils.sampleMultiNormalHypercube}} to set test seed itself, IMO we should at least update it's javadoc with note about prerequisite for deterministic results.

Btw, second line in parameterless {{RandomWrapper}} constructor (line 33 that sets seed) seems to be redundant (seed is already set in used {{MersenneTwister}} parameterless constructor). Not complaining :) just thinking out loud, to maybe get extra opinion before actually making changes.

author.name: tdunning
author.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body: Here is a revised patch with all suggestions implemented (except the change to RandomWrapper and the call to useTestSeed in the hypercube generation function)

updateAuthor.name: tdunning
updateAuthor.emailAddress: ted dot dunning at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Tests pass locally with patch applied. Changes look good to me, can be applied.

Step in good direction - of getting Apache Mahout builds to be stable and fast.

FAILURE: Integrated in Mahout-Quality #2248 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Mahout-Quality/2248/])
MAHOUT-1320: Made ball and streaming k-means clustering tests deterministic by using test seed (tdunning via sslavic) (sslavic: rev 1524116)

* /mahout/trunk/core/src/test/java/org/apache/mahout/clustering/streaming/cluster/StreamingKMeansTest.java
* /mahout/trunk/core/src/test/java/org/apache/mahout/clustering/streaming/mapreduce/StreamingKMeansTestMR.java
